pull.title: Copyright headers for build scripts
pull.body:
This needs sign-off from: ~~@morcos @anddam~~ @brandondahler ~~@btcdrak @casey~~ @theuni @cozz ~~@dcousens @ers35 @EthanHeilman @gavinandresen~~ @gmaxwell ~~@jamesob~~ ~~@jgarzik @jonasschnelli~~ @jtimon ~~@joshtriplett~~ @kazcw ~~@maraoz~~ @MarcoFalke ~~@maaku~~ @TheBlueMatt @fanquake ~~@musalbas~~ @pstratem ~~@paveljanik~~ @Diapolo ~~@sipa @rnicoll @SergioDemianLerner @sdaftuar @laanwj @yurizhykin @dexX7 @nomnombtc @ntrgn @ptschip @randy-waterhouse @sinetek~~

~~@knocte~~ @joshtriplett 

~~@ajtowns @dooglus @onlyjob @wtogami~~ @imwuzhh

Permission from Tim Kosse has already been obtained:

```
[22:45:45] <codesquid> yes, shouldn't be an issue to put this one under MIT license
```

events.message: Add MIT license to autogen.sh and share/genbuild.sh
Add MIT license to build-aux/m4 scripts

events.body: I sign-off on changing the license of these build scripts as indicated.

I approve of adding license information.

I don't think it's a great idea to include the typo fixing commit here given the subject of this PR, but you probably don't care what I think about that.
I approve of placing the build scripts under MIT license.

Can't we have a general policy that everything committed to the repository must be put under MIT license?  (e.g. github shows this repository as MIT) no matter what is at the top of the individual file.

This just keeps going on and on and on (this pull, #8702, #8701, #8700, #8676, are just the **last few days**), Micromanaging every file in this way results in a lot of overhead for everyone involved, which could be spent on solving one of the many actual problems.

So I really never want to repeat this again.

issue.title: Mandatory copyright agreement
issue.body: All contributions to the repository will agree to use the MIT license.

events.body:
:+1: from me.

@laanwj Agreed; I already assumed from the top-level COPYING file containing the MIT license that any contributions were under the MIT license unless otherwise specified.

Approved

On Thu, Sep 22, 2016, 11:47 Pieter Wuille notifications@github.com wrote:

> I approve.
> 
> 
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8784#issuecomment-248803896, or mute
> the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AARh1Qj6TjszqTSAkIMxKu7mj_YpFDJ-ks5qsfpigaJpZM4KDX7b
> .
@luke-jr Many of those that were pinged already gave a permanent ACK on all of their past contributions to this repo to be explicitly MIT licensed.
@MarcoFalke Is there a record of who has done so?
Yes, my point is there's no easy way to find these.

Approved.

But also like someone said:

> I already assumed from the top-level COPYING file containing the MIT license that any contributions were under the MIT license unless otherwise specified.
My contribution was trivial, but I definitely approve the PR.

1) ACK/approved for all my contributions, @luke-jr 

2) The project should consider something like the Linux kernel's developer sign-off, to augment the MIT license: http://developercertificate.org

> 2) The project should consider something like the Linux kernel's developer sign-off, to augment the MIT license: http://developercertificate.org

Agree, but I think right now we are missing the infrastructure to do so.

issue.title: Update license information for files under build-aux/m4
issue.body:
https://github.com/zcash/zcash/blob/master/build-aux/m4/l_atomic.m4#L4 says that file is sourced from http://bugs.debian.org/797228 , which in turn references this file from Filezilla: https://svn.filezilla-project.org/filezilla/FileZilla3/trunk/m4/check_atomic.m4?revision=6938&view=markup&pathrev=6938

Filezilla is [GPLv2-licensed](https://svn.filezilla-project.org/filezilla/FileZilla3/trunk/COPYING?view=markup), and I cannot find any exception for the license of the Autoconf macros it uses.

This is a problem because the GPLv2 license affects everything else. Note that the output of the macro is arguably *also* implicitly GPLv2-licensed as a derived work of the macro (since there's no exception that would exclude it from being so licensed). I think we need to replace this file, or get permission to include it under a more permissive license.

issue.title: [Port] Copyright headers for build scripts
issue.body:
Port bitcoin core #8784

0c4e6ce Add MIT license to build-aux/m4 scripts (Luke Dashjr)
3f8a5d8 Trivial: build-aux/m4/l_atomic: Fix typo (Luke Dashjr)
3b4b6dc Add MIT license to autogen.sh and share/genbuild.sh (Luke Dashjr)
f4dffdd Add MIT license to Makefiles (Luke Dashjr)

issue.title: Update license info
issue.body:
Includes commits cherry-picked from bitcoin/bitcoin#8784 with some minor changes.

Fixes #2827.

issue.title: Update LevelDB to upstream commit f545dfabf
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#7911
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7982
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8133
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8784
  - Only the missing changes.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8826
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8613
- bitcoin/bitcoin#10544
- bitcoin/bitcoin#10633
  - Only the changes to files and code we have.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#10806
- bitcoin/bitcoin#10958
- bitcoin/bitcoin#12451
- bitcoin/bitcoin#13925
- bitcoin/bitcoin#15270

This upgrades LevelDB in the exact same commit progression as upstream, up to January 2019.

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.
